item.title: Report E-2024020017
item.description:
Report E-2024020017

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-05T15:13:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-30
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UPH experienced a release from 7 boxes each containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 4-gallons of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. The damaged jugs were placed into a 55-gallon vented poly drum. The impacted cardboard, PPE, absorbents, and pallet wood were containerized separately into a 55-gallon vented poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024010832
item.description:
Report X-2024010832

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-01T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-05
  • City: YUMA
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Ops manager was sending the hazmat on the hytrol up the belt, the plastic pail fell from it and it caused a puncture. After seeing this QA personnel grabbed a hazmat tote and cleaned up the area. DescribePack: Plastic pail was punctured at the bottom upon falling. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Pail was put in a hazmat tote and moved from the area to the repack table.

item.title: Report I-2024100046
item.description:
Report I-2024100046

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-05T15:13:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-28
  • City: Phoenix
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES GROUP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A customer exited an aft Lavatory and handed an overheating vape that they had found in the Lavatory to a Flight Attendant. The vape was making a clicking sound and was warm to the touch. The Flight Attendants placed the vape in a fire containment bag with water. The Captain was notified and the balance of the Flight was uneventful. Upon arrival, the Flight Attendants handed the fire containment bag with the vape to a Customer Service Manager at the Station.

item.title: Report E-2024010532
item.description:
Report E-2024010532

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-03T00:50:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-16
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver left customers after completing unloading. Customer reported they saw the trailer leaking on their property and leaving the property. Hose had product in it from unloading. Potential gasket issue and possible reason for leaking. Driver stopped at near by truck stop to conduct inspection and found hose leaking.
